basis: The user explicitly commits to a stepwise plan (water, box breathing, hunger rating) with an optional tiny bite and built-in pauses, and requests reminders to check in with a support person. This strongly aligns with following the suggested flow.
cognitive_dissonance: Moderate. The user is anxious about eating and wary of external suggestions, yet actively seeks a structured, low-pressure approach. They attempt to reconcile control with flexibility by keeping bites optional and pauses available.
negative_thought_patterns: Anxiety about eating; fear of being pressured; susceptibility to social influence; potential all-or-nothing thinking about having to follow the plan exactly.
emotional_triggers: Anxiety around hunger/food, desire for safety and control, discomfort with potential judgment, heat/discomfort from environment.
coaching_notes: Maintain the calm, actionable structure. Emphasize bite optionality and pausing. Reinforce 5â€“10 minute check-ins and quick prompts to contact a support person. Use grounding techniques as needed and normalize stopping anytime. Track hunger ratings to build trust and gradual progress.
